page.title: 06Helicopters at the Airport
page.content: One of the air-traffic controllers at the airport gave us an interview about the helicopters used to fly out oil workers to the rigs. The helicopters used by Bristows seat 22 oil workers and contain 2 dingies - a 32 man and a 19 man. There are 5 escape hatches on this type of helicopter. On the left side there's a rear hatch and dingy. In the middle, the main entry door and emergency windows, with the cargo door at the front.Each door is marked with instructions on how to open it. Other helicopters do use the airport from time to time including the one that supplies the lighthouse on Muckle Flugga and transfers the lighthouse keepers to the shore.
